author: abcoathup
content:
Caveat: **not a core dev**, but posting here in case aids with the discussion.

Dencun upgrade schedule prediction (assume no major issues & EIP4788 audit ok):
* **Devnet-9** early September
* No Dencun specific testnet as L2s currently use Goerli
* **Goerli** upgrade mid September (4 weeks for L2s to test, Goerli deprecated)
* **Sepolia** mid October (2 weeks, L2s moving to Sepolia, Arbitrum just added)
* **Hole≈°ky** early November (2 weeks)
* **mainnet** mid November (clashes with Devconnect, so as per Ben could be a couple of weeks later)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> it would be huge if we could do mainnet before or around Devconnect

author: terencechain
content: I think that timeline is pretty aggressive

author: __kasey__
content: We're debugging issues in devnet-8 still - so early September (presumably that means "next week") seems off for devnet-9. Building on that observation, "mid-September" for Goerli must be off as well. It seems likely we'll find tricky performance issues in Goerli testing, and those can take time to test and build confidence. Keep propagating prediction errors forward (with more variables, like: L2s start testing and experimenting more hardcore; Holesky is a new network with a large val set) and my wild guess is this is easily off base by 1-3 months.

author: .paulharris
content: imo it'd need to be a good week before if we were to attempt to, because a lot of people will be in flight (literally) if anything goes boom

author: .paulharris
content:
Given that most teams will probably be releasing very shortly for the initial holesky settings, it'd mean we need to release for goerli basically straight after that if we were to allow people any time to update their clients... we'd want at least a week for validators to update their nodes, even if it is a testnet...
I think i'd agree with <@363800010518822915> , probably leaning towards 'unrealistic'
